description: From French fuchsine, of unknown origin. Possibly from fuchsia +‎ -ine, because of its colour, or from German Fuchs (“fox”) + -ine, because of the first manufacturer, Renard (renard means “fox” in French).

entries.meaning: A dye (rosaniline hydrochloride, C20H19N3·HCl) usually a deep red or magenta colour.
